lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* The main class that Duke is invoked on.

* @param fileName the name of the storage file which Duke will store its data in.
* This is the main run method for Duke.
* This is the main method which invokes Duke to run.

/** String used to represent the deadline of task. */
/** String used to assign the name of the task. */

* @param by The deadline of the task.
* @param b The status of the task.
public Deadline(String desc, String by, boolean b) {

public Event(String desc, String from, String to, boolean b) {

public void executeCommand(String inputCommand, TaskList tasks, Storage storage, Ui ui) throws DukeException {

throw new DukeException("Description of deadline cannot be empty!!");
throw new DukeException("Description of event cannot be empty!!");
throw new DukeException("Please enter a valid number to delete!");
throw new DukeException("Description of todo cannot be empty!!");
throw new DukeException("I don't get it!");

System.out.println("I marked this task as done:\n" + tasks.get(index - 1));
* Method to unmark the selected task as done.

System.out.println("I marked this task as undone:\n" + tasks.get(index - 1));

System.out.println("What can I do for you today?\n");
assertEquals("[E][ ] DEVCON (from: Monday to: Tuesday)", new Event("DEVCON", "Monday", "Tuesday").toString());
assertEquals("[E][X] UNICON (from: Monday to: Tuesday)", new Event("UNICON", "Monday", "Tuesday", true).toString());
deadline return book /by when I feel like it
event project meeting /from life starts /to life ends
